content.webTitle: Schalk Bezuidenhout: 'The funniest book? My maths handbook in school'

fields.headline: Schalk Bezuidenhout: 'The funniest book? My maths handbook in school'
fields.bodyText: The funniest standup I’ve ever seen … You either love him or hate him, but the Adam Sandler comedy special on Netflix is hilarious. It has made me want to push the boundaries of traditional standup a bit more. The funniest book I’ve ever read … My maths handbook in school. All I could really do was laugh. The funniest TV show I’ve ever seen … The Afrikaans channels in South Africa do reality TV very well. I once watched an Afrikaans version of Come Dine With Me and nearly died from laughter. The funniest film I’ve ever seen … I probably quote Anchorman on a daily basis. The funniest person I know … It has to be my mother. Not as in the way a comedian is funny. More like a super cringe “posting photos of her garden on Facebook” kind of funny. The funniest heckle I’ve ever had … Once a dog barked at me during my set. The funniest item of clothing I’ve ever owned … Everyone always laughs when I wear a Speedo, but I don’t find it funny at all. I think I look great. The funniest hairstyle I’ve ever had … I played a villain in a Shakespeare play and had to shave the sides and leave a little patch at the top. As if my moustache doesn’t make me look creepy enough. The funniest dream I’ve ever had … I mostly have anxiety-filled nightmares, so trying to pick the funniest one would be like picking the funniest of all the scary clowns. The funniest thing that shouldn’t be funny … A dog with sunglasses on. Why is it funny? It shouldn’t be. It’s just a dog with sunglasses on. Yet it’s hilarious. The funniest number … 8888888. The funniest word … Brexit. For Schalk Bezuidenhout’s future live dates, visit schalkbezuidenhout.com. Follow him on Twitter @schalkiebez
